ISSUE.TITLE: Podman complaining about missing global policy.json while a local one is present
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Issue Description I installed Podman through Nix. I have a `policy.json` defined as this in `/home/MYUSER/.config/containers/policy.json`: ```json { "default": [ { "type": "insecureAcceptAnything" } ] } ``` I don't have an `/etc/containers/policy.json`. If i issue a `podman image trust show` I get an `Error: open /etc/containers/policy.json: no such file or directory` . I checked running strace and I do see that `newfstatat(AT_FDCWD, "/home/MYUSER/.config/containers/policy.json", {st_mode=S_IFREG|0644, st_size=93, ...}, 0) = 0` but still get the error of the missing /etc/containers/policy.json file. ### Steps to reproduce the issue Steps to reproduce the issue 1. Have a local (/home/MYUSER/.config/containers/policy.json) policy file 2. Run `podman image trust show` 3. See it fail with error message regarding missing /etc/containers/policy.json ### Describe the results you received I get an `Error: open /etc/containers/policy.json: no such file or directory`. ```bash $ podman image trust set -t reject default Error: open /etc/containers/policy.json: permission denied ``` If we enforce with `sudo` then /etc/containers/policy.json gets created. ### Describe the results you expected I expect the local `policy.json` to be sufficient and be the only file read. ### podman info output ```yaml ❯❯❯ podman version Client: Podman Engine Version: 4.5.1 API Version: 4.5.1 Go Version: go1.20.5 Built: Tue Jan 1 01:00:00 1980 OS/Arch: linux/amd64 ❯❯❯ podman info host: arch: amd64 buildahVersion: 1.30.0 cgroupControllers: [] cgroupManager: cgroupfs cgroupVersion: v1 conmon: package: Unknown path: /nix/store/bbxml9qrpvlq8hijvamqwd2mk0wcknsw-conmon-2.1.7/bin/conmon version: 'conmon version 2.1.7, commit: ' cpuUtilization: idlePercent: 88.9 systemPercent: 3.33 userPercent: 7.77 cpus: 8 databaseBackend: boltdb distribution: distribution: fedora variant: kde version: "35" eventLogger: journald hostname: MyMachine idMappings: gidmap: -
